TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit CollationElementIterator extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Created by a RuleBasedCollator to iterate through a string.

remarks.para: Created by a RuleBasedCollator to iterate through a string. The result of each iteration is a 32-bit collation element that defines the ordering priority of the next character or sequence of characters in the source string.
For illustration, consider the following in Spanish:
"ca": the first collation element is collation_element('c') and second collation element is collation_element('a').
Since "ch" in Spanish sorts as one entity, the example below returns one collation element for the two characters 'c' and 'h':
"cha": the first collation element is collation_element('ch') and the second one is collation_element('a').
In German, since the character '\u0086' is a composed character of 'a' and 'e', the iterator returns two collation elements for the single character '\u0086':
"\u0086b": the first collation element is collation_element('a'), the second one is collation_element('e'), and the third collation element is collation_element('b').

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 GetMaxExpansion(int32 order) cil managed

Docs.param: a collation element that has been previously obtained from a call to either the or method.
Docs.summary: Obtains the maximum length of any expansion sequence that ends with the specified collation element.

remarks.para: Obtains the maximum length of any expansion sequence that ends with the specified collation element. Returns 1 if there is no expansion with this collation element as the last element.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 Next() cil managed

Docs.summary: Obtains the next collation element in the source string.

remarks.para: Obtains the next collation element in the source string.

Docs.summary: This constant is returned by the iterator in the methods next() and previous() when the end or the beginning of the source string has been reached, and there are no more valid collation elements to return.

remarks.para: This constant is returned by the iterator in the methods next() and previous() when the end or the beginning of the source string has been reached, and there are no more valid collation elements to return.

Docs.summary: Obtains the character offset in the source string corresponding to the next collation element.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Obtains the character offset in the source string corresponding to the next collation element. This value could be any of:
The index of the first character in the source string that matches the value of the next collation element. This means that if setOffset(offset) sets the index in the middle of a contraction, getOffset() returns the index of the first character in the contraction, which may not be equal to the original offset that was set. Hence calling getOffset() immediately after setOffset(offset) does not guarantee that the original offset set will be returned.
If normalization is on, the index of the immediate subsequent character, or composite character with the first character, having a combining class of 0.
The length of the source string, if iteration has reached the end.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Points the iterator at the collation element associated with the character in the source string which is found at the supplied offset. After this call completes, an invocation of the method will return this collation element.
If newOffset corresponds to a character which is part of a sequence that maps to a single collation element then the iterator is adjusted to the start of that sequence. As a result of this, any subsequent call made to getOffset() may not return the same value set by this method.
If the decomposition mode is on, and offset is in the middle of a decomposable range of source text, the iterator may not return a correct result for the next forwards or backwards iteration. The user must ensure that the offset is not in the middle of a decomposable range.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 Previous() cil managed

Docs.summary: Obtains the previous collation element in the source string.

remarks.para: Obtains the previous collation element in the source string.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig int32 PrimaryOrder(int32 order) cil managed

Docs.summary: Obtains the primary order of the specified collation element, i.e. the first 16 bits.

remarks.para: Obtains the primary order of the specified collation element, i.e. the first 16 bits. This value is unsigned.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Reset() cil managed

Docs.summary: Repositions the cursor to point at the first element of the current string.

remarks.para: Repositions the cursor to point at the first element of the current string. The next call to or will return the first and last collation element in the string, respectively.
If the RuleBasedCollator used by this iterator has had its attributes changed, calling reset() reinitializes the iterator to use the new attributes.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig int16 SecondaryOrder(int32 order) cil managed

Docs.summary: Obtains the secondary order of the specified collation element, i.e. the 16th to 23th bits, inclusive.

remarks.para: Obtains the secondary order of the specified collation element, i.e. the 16th to 23th bits, inclusive. This value is unsigned.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetText(class Java.Text.ICharacterIterator source) cil managed

Docs.param: the new source string iterator for iteration.
Docs.summary: Sets a new source string iterator for iteration, and resets the offset to the beginning of the text.

remarks.para: Sets a new source string iterator for iteration, and resets the offset to the beginning of the text.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetText(string source) cil managed

Docs.param: the new source string for iteration.
Docs.summary: Sets a new source string for iteration, and resets the offset to the beginning of the text.

remarks.para: Sets a new source string for iteration, and resets the offset to the beginning of the text.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig int16 TertiaryOrder(int32 order) cil managed

Docs.summary: Obtains the tertiary order of the specified collation element, i.e. the last 8 bits.

remarks.para: Obtains the tertiary order of the specified collation element, i.e. the last 8 bits. This value is unsigned.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
